ISSUE.TITLE: _RentalInfo mobile issue
ISSUE.DESCRIPTION: When you click on the date input textfields on a mobile device, you trigger the default behavior, which is to open a keyboard. It is absolutely redundant to allow that to happen, because of the ui-datepicker that appears. Also it is really annoying when the keyboard on most devices covers a lot of the screen and you need to click at least once more to close it, and then use the ui-datepicker. The solution for that is pretty simple, you just need to add the attribute readonly to the input and voila, the mobile default behavior is disabled: <input id="@(startDateControlId)" name="@(startDateControlId)" type="text" class="datepicker" value="@(Model.RentalStartDate.HasValue ? Model.RentalStartDate.Value.ToString(datePickerFormat2, CultureInfo.InvariantCulture) : null)" readonly /> Since this is only for mobile devices, if you still want people to be able to type inside the input textfield, you could use the "Detecting mobile device with Javascript" approach (http://www.abeautifulsite.net/detecting-mobile-devices-with-javascript/) and remove it this way or the C# approach directly inside the view: <input id="@(startDateControlId)" name="@(startDateControlId)" type="text" class="datepicker" value="@(Model.RentalStartDate.HasValue ? Model.RentalStartDate.Value.ToString(datePickerFormat2, CultureInfo.InvariantCulture) : null)" @if(Request.Browser.IsMobileDevice){<text>readonly</text>} /> Source: http://www.nopcommerce.com/boards/t/41236/_rentalinfo-mobile-issue.aspx
